commit f9046b4f21d090417fb28a038b612d120c9fa5db
Merge: 42ff04c8 d4b5843b

commit 42ff04c884b84e69ec66ce6e56cd380c73e0f6e9
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.nunez-iglesias@monash.edu>
Date:   2019-03-04 16:51:03 +1100

    WIP: Reduce the default tolerance in threshold_li (#3622)
    
    * Reduce the default tolerance in threshold_li
    
    Fixes #3605
    
    In that issue, I found that a tolerance of `range / 2**15` was
    sufficient. However, the only thing that guarantees convergence is the
    smallest intensity difference in the image (it's impossible for the
    update to change if the threshold doesn't change). I've set this as the
    new default, as the only downside is that it might take a long time to
    converge, but that seems preferable to finding an incorrect threshold.
    
    * Fix documentation of tolerance in threshold_li

3	4	skimage/filters/thresholding.py

commit bfa614a5578964466290eda6fe59231a74cc1724
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.nunez-iglesias@monash.edu>
Date:   2019-02-18 13:11:50 +1100

    Remove seam carving (#3751)
    
    * Remove seam carving
    
    Seam carving is a patented algorithm and so cannot be distributed with
    scikit-image, which must offer code that can be used "without charge and
    without restriction".
    
    Currently, attempting to run `seam_carve` will cause a
    `NotImplementedError`, and then it can be removed altogether in 0.16.
    
    Fixes #3646
    
    * Fix Python 2 support release note

3	0	TODO.txt

10	61	skimage/transform/seam_carving.py
1	4	skimage/transform/setup.py
3	24	skimage/transform/tests/test_seam_carving.py

commit 8d09f1a52140bba661d46354525e8dc80ab542e8
Author: Lars Grueter <lagru@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2019-02-15 21:39:59 +0100

    FIX: Make local_maxima return a boolean array (#3749)
    
    * BUG: Make local_maxima return a boolean array
    
    In contrast to returning an array of 1s and 0s, a boolean array can be
    used as a mask to index an array of the same shape.
    
    * MAINT: Consistently make `selem` a boolean array
    
    Passing in an array of 0s and 1s will still work but the docstring
    demands a boolean array now which is consistent with the output of
    scipy.ndimage.generate_binary_structure. Thus this change should be
    backwards-compatible (covered by extended tests).
    
    * DOC: Describe default selem/connectivity more precisely

commit 4846bd0f7d0308ac54493a9dd4696d9f77e58085
Author: Taylor D. Scott <taylor-scott@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2019-02-08 18:56:21 -0600

    Replace np.einsum with np.tensordot in _upsampled_dft (#3710)
    
    * Replace np.einsum with np.tensordot in _upsampled_dft
    
    _upsampled_dft uses np.einsum to compute the upsampled DFT
    of an image. This is not easily generalizable and in numpy < 1.12 is
    (extremely) slow because no optimize flag is available.
    
    np.einsum can be replaced with sequential calls to np.tensordot which is
    generalizable to higher dimensions.
    
    * Add test for 4D image registration, pixel-level
    
    * Add test for 4D image registration, subpixel registration
    
    * Delete no 4d image test
    
    * Add support for subpixel registration for nD images in register_translation
    
    * Fix flake8 problems
    
    * 2D or 3D -> nD
    
    * Add benchmarks for register_translation
    
    * Use tensordot in 2D case
    
    * ndarray -> array in docstrings
    
    * Remove version check in test_3d_input
    
    * Clean up kernel statement
    
    * kernel.shape -> (ups_size, image_dim) to make tensordot operation more clear
    
    * Calculate CCmax as the max of cross_correlation by absolute value
    
    * PEP8 formatting
    
    * Bugfix:  instead of  in kernel generation
    
    * Add name to CONTRIBUTORS.txt

3	0	CONTRIBUTORS.txt
40	1	benchmarks/benchmark_feature.py
23	62	skimage/feature/register_translation.py
28	17	skimage/feature/tests/test_register_translation.py

commit 165fee50ccdaa4d37a421fc7917e0b04483b8668
Author: Jotham Apaloo <jotham.apaloo@ospreyinformatics.com>
Date:   2019-01-09 09:26:08 -0700

    Clarify that urllib objects are being mocked
    
    Named importation forces us to mock the local name
    
    skimage/io/util.py
    from urllib.request import urlopen
    
    skimage/io/tests/test_io.py
        ...
        monkeypatch.setattr('skimage.io.util.urlopen', mockopen)
    
    we want to be clear that the mock is of an external library. this patch
    achieves that at the expense not being as concise. Fair tradeoff

3	3	skimage/io/tests/test_io.py
3	4	skimage/io/util.py

    TST: don't use the pytest.fixtures decorator anymore in class fixtures as explained by a pytest warning
    
    RemovedInPytest4Warning: Fixture "setUp" called directly. Fixtures are
    not meant to be called directly, are created automatically when test
    functions request them as parameters. See
    https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/fixture.html for more information.

commit 29a22e17c8b4ccf26383e3007ab014eb18b81f12
Author: Lars Grüter <lagru@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2018-11-13 21:34:04 +0100

     Fix morphology.local_maxima for input with any dimension < 3 (#3447)
    
    * Fix local_maxima for input with dimensions < 3
    
    local_maxima (and local_minima) failed with an ValueError for images
    with at least 1 dimension with fewer than 3 elements. This was due to
    the implementation which applies a structuring element with exactly 3
    elements in each dimension to the image in question. This behavior was
    only visible if `allow_borders` was false, otherwise the image was
    padded internally.
    This fix makes these functions work for the mentioned edge cases by
    testing the image shape at the appropriate time.
    
    * Fix output of local_maxima for empty arrays
    
    The old output for empty arrays if `indices` was true didn't correspond
    to the output for non-empty arrays and the description in the docstring.
    This ensures that the output will always be a tuple of empty arrays.
    
    If `indices` is false, the returned empty array now machtes the shape of
    `image` as well.
    
    * Show warning if no maxima are possible
    
    which is the case for dimensions with fewer than 3 samples. Because
    `local_minima` wraps `local_maxima` the warning can only set the correct
    stacklevel for one of these functions. The latter was chosen because it
    stands to reason that it is / will be used more frequently.
    
    If may be possible to suppress and re-raise the warning with the context
    manager from the warnings module but that would introduce non-thread-
    safe code and introduce perhaps unnecessary complexity.
    
    * Point user to allow_borders in warning message

3	0	doc/release/release_dev.rst
48	23	skimage/morphology/extrema.py
42	4	skimage/morphology/tests/test_extrema.py

commit 28a61daf25a4b4bd01f7aefb3ef83ac2c5a4570d
Author: ratijas <ratijas@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2018-10-04 10:13:29 +0300

    DOC: fix LaTeX build via `make latexpdf` (#3441)
    
    a) `startdocname` (first element of 5-tuple) in latex_documents
    configuration was renamed from 'contents' to 'index' some time ago.
    Now this change is reflected in LaTex configuration too.
    b) Surname 'Schönberger' was writter as letter 'O' followed by
    Combining Diaeresis U+308 which gave latexmk hard times parsing it.
    Using Latin Small Letter O with Diaeresis U+00F6 is fine though.

1	1	doc/release/release_0.14.rst
1	1	doc/source/conf.py

commit 7f09e07ddf631c50b9e98a739decf86eb9ed34af
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.nunez-iglesias@monash.edu>
Date:   2018-10-04 16:13:19 +1000

    Update instructions et al for releases after 0.14.1 (#3442)
    
    * Release notes for 0.14.1 (#3395)
    
    * Update release notes to 0.14.1
    
     - Add missing contributions spotted by @hmaarrfk
     - Rephrase wording describing #3374
     - Update version to 0.14.1
    
    * Use original PR numbers in release notes, not backports
    
    * Actually sort contributor names by alphabetical order
    
    * Add Legodev to the contributors for this release
    
    * Update release notes with 3406
    
    * Update instructions for building docs for releases
    
    make html in the doc directory didn't work. make html within the root
    directory worked flawlessly (after installing numpydoc).
    
    * Update the docs only after wheels have built
    
    Wheel building is the biggest stumbling block and most likely to fail.
    If we update the docs before that, there might be a long lag between
    when the docs show the new version, and when the new version is actually
    available.
    
    * Add .appveyor.yml to instructions for wheels
    
    scikit-image-wheels builds on AppVeyor for Windows wheels. That version
    also needs updating.
    
    * Further clarify how to monitor wheel builds
    
    * Add Windows wheels to wheel_uploader script
    
    * Add step to delete downloaded wheels
    
    * Add final steps of submitting PRs to master
    
    * Update conda-forge instructions
    
    * Clarify instructions for patch releases
    
    * Only make clean doc builds for releases
    
    * Switch branches in scikit-image-wheels if making patch release

50	12	RELEASE.txt
120	0	doc/release/release_0.14.rst
1	0	requirements/docs.txt
1	0	tools/upload_wheels.sh

commit b72496fdfc7bebca17c5634441f2a4387df57289

2	2	skimage/filters/thresholding.py

commit ce6652892621294b970092f8fb1fd23600fb760f
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.nunez-iglesias@monash.edu>
Date:   2018-09-13 18:48:04 +1000

    Update Li thresholding
    
    - images with np.nan and np.inf values are now processed correctly
    - `temp` value becoming negative was impossible, and this line was not
      covered, so removed it
    - code contained numerous fixes for integer offset errors. Since we
      deal with floating point, these are unnecessary. The code is now
      much simpler
    - it is also more correct: the tolerance offset that was applied
      previously in fact was giving an incorrect threshold. I verify this
      with a new private function, _cross_entropy, which estimates the
      cross-entropy between foreground and background as defined in the
      original paper.
    
    The only fly in this sweet ointment is that for *one* of our test
    images, coins, the threshold found by the iterative method is one off
    (or rather 0.32316 off, but this happens to fall on either side of an
    integer) from the optimal threshold. I believe this is an unavoidable
    side effect of images being discretized into integer bins.

51	14	skimage/filters/tests/test_thresholding.py
89	33	skimage/filters/thresholding.py

commit b62ebf673ac19dcbf5106cdb4afcb1c381408c7c
Author: Jesse Pangburn <jesse.pangburn@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-08-11 21:59:04 -0700

    Correct rotate method's center parameter doc
    
    The existing doc for the center parameter of the rotate method implies the parameter should look like (rows, cols) but in fact it operates in (cols, rows) ordering.  This commit corrects the documentation to clarify the unusual usage of (cols, rows) ordering.

Merge: 3ffd326c b4f826a4

commit b4f826a47a368df37da73b1d36369e6857ae71e4
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.nunez-iglesias@monash.edu>
Date:   2018-07-26 20:13:27 +1000

    Replace scipy.sparse.*.todense() with toarray()
    
    NumPy 1.15 started warning about not using `np.matrix`, which breaks our
    CI, because `todense()` returns a `np.matrix` rather than a `np.array`.
    Replacing this with `toarray()` removes the warning and has no effect on
    the expressions where it is being replaced.

3	3	skimage/segmentation/random_walker_segmentation.py

commit 2c24aff102ee1f9f9fd74fef25832a8593101281
Author: Gregory R. Lee <gregory.lee@cchmc.org>
Date:   2018-07-24 12:56:57 -0400

    denoise_wavelet: warn the user if the wavelet is not orthogonal.
    
    Biorthogonal wavelets transforms color white noise and the filters used do not have unit
    norm. This violates assumptions made by the thresholding routines, leading to suboptimal
    performance. We should warn the user if such a wavelet is selected.
    
    Add a note on wavelet choise to the denoise_wavelet docstring
    
    Add test for UserWarning on biorthogonal wavelet for denoising.
    
    add rationale for orthogonal wavelets to the denoise_wavelet notes

16	2	skimage/restoration/_denoise.py
7	0	skimage/restoration/tests/test_denoise.py

commit 0264bab7695a54888635f81d566a80078d6ddedd
Author: John Kirkham <kirkhamj@janelia.hhmi.org>
Date:   2018-07-10 17:51:11 -0400

    Simplify the Dask Array test of `apply_parallel`
    
    Now that a Dask Array will be preserved by `apply_parallel` (unless a
    user specifically overrides it), update the test to drop the `compute`
    argument in this case. As there already is a test to ensure the result
    is a Dask Array, this should work as a test of the current behavior (in
    addition to the NumPy case where we set `compute`).

11	2	skimage/util/tests/test_apply_parallel.py

commit 3d5a83e97fa3e809485ce38de0d8d279cc917ebd
Author: John Kirkham <kirkhamj@janelia.hhmi.org>
Date:   2018-07-10 17:51:10 -0400

    Set `compute` in `apply_parallel` based on array
    
    If the input is a Dask Array, assume that lazy computation was intended.
    If the input is anything other than a Dask Array, assume eager
    computation was intended. This should provide a bit more sensible
    default behavior for `compute` (particularly if users forget to set it).
    Though the `compute` option remains to override should it be needed.

8	3	skimage/util/apply_parallel.py

commit 75f74d567a5b65db5b0c1906f9ce88c127ba042a
Author: Egor Panfilov <egor.v.panfilov@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-07-07 21:43:32 +0300

commit 1ac5da79eb13783a29a644ce7d88b85a93187e16
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2018-06-18 12:07:02 +1000

    Return slice tuple instead of list to index array
    
    Using lists will be deprecated as of NumPy 1.15. See
    https://github.com/numpy/numpy/blob/master/doc/release/1.15.0-notes.rst
    under "Multidimensional indexing" for details.

1	1	skimage/viewer/canvastools/painttool.py

commit c80d7c2894a9c656d181c09876e6da03f77b91f0
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2018-06-18 12:02:20 +1000

    Fix painttool indexing in the viewer to use int
    
    Indexing of arrays with float types was deprecated in NumPy 1.11 and
    has been unsupported since NumPy 1.12.
    
    See
    https://github.com/numpy/numpy/blob/master/doc/release/1.11.0-notes.rst
    and
    https://github.com/numpy/numpy/blob/master/doc/release/1.12.0-notes.rst

10	1	skimage/viewer/canvastools/painttool.py

Author: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>
Date:   2018-06-14 14:11:29 +0200

    Fix labeling for large datasets
    
    Previously, labeling a large dataset would silently fail (falsely
    mis-label all data after a certain point). With this patch this is
    avoided, by using long integers for the calculations.
    
    Signed-off-by: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>

    Specify conda-forge channel for install docs
    
    Currently the conda default channel directs you to scikit-image 0.13.1, instead of the current stable release 0.14
    Better to specify `conda install -c conda-forge scikit-image`
    See https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image-web/issues/48

commit ef78faf04435717a1b5797bc1a02c73d9b5e8e7f
Author: jakirkham <jakirkham@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-05-30 13:54:35 -0700

    Lazy apply_parallel (#3121)
    
    * Allow `apply_parallel` to compute lazily
    
    Provides an option to allow disabling of computation of the result from
    `apply_parallel` thus providing a Dask Array that can be chained in
    further operations. By default, compute the result just as it already
    does.
    
    * Include a test of using `apply_parallel` lazily
    
    Ensure that `apply_parallel` returns a Dask Array if `compute=False`.
    Also still compute this array to ensure this gives the expected result.
    
    * Make `compute` keyword only
    
    * Handle a Dask Array as input to `apply_parallel`
    
    Make some adjustments to `apply_parallel` to only convert non-Dask
    Arrays into Dask Arrays. Passes through Dask Arrays unchanged (with the
    exception of applying the operations to them).
    
    * Document the `compute` keyword argument

30	5	skimage/util/apply_parallel.py
30	0	skimage/util/tests/test_apply_parallel.py

commit 5bdcec6b0ba923fca3ddb735a7de4b66a8698899
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefanv@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2018-03-13 12:22:32 -0700

    Use skimage gaussian filter to avoid integer rounding artifacts
    
    scipy.ndimage.gaussian_filter tries to preserve dtypes, which leads to
    the output of operations on integer input being less accurate than it
    should be.

commit 12f408715caa2b7f56a57ec0ad379a6f9c07b010
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2017-10-13 17:15:18 +1100

    Make `regionprops._slice` a user-facing property
    
    Currently, `_slice` is hidden from the user, even though it would be
    a useful property in many instances (for example, extracting objects
    from one channel based on the regionprops of another). In fact there
    was a discussion about this when we were talking about the bounding box
    property, but that went nowhere.

10	6	skimage/measure/_regionprops.py
13	2	skimage/measure/tests/test_regionprops.py

commit e29ed81e1c142058069e1697a46924baf19d72b8
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2018-05-03 19:30:36 +1000

    Allow float->float conversion of any range
    
    Fixes #3051.
    
    When converting from float, we were checking for valid input ranges
    *before* checking whether the target format was also float, in which
    case the range doesn't matter. This PR corrects this so that float-only
    conversions, which don't entail any rescaling, don't check for input
    range.

commit 46b3b7562f0c14ddfeace2484767e270387b14a8
Author: Mark Harfouche <mark.harfouche@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-04-28 22:57:48 -0700

    Avoid an extra copy during conversion to floating types
    
    The speedup is actually due to a few things:
    1. Division is replaced by multiplication. This a 25-30% speedup for
       array smaller than 10MB (probably due to cache)
    2. The array isn't simply allocated without use. This is useful for very
       large arrays. 100MB arrays see a 10% improvement when combined with
       the previous point.
    
    I don't know of a good way to benchmark it, so I created a short script.
    
    Few things to note:
    1. There may be a few other places where this can be applied. Look for
    locations where `image.astype` is used.
    2. There may be some advantage for letting the user provide his own output
    array. Is this even done in skimage?
    
    ```python
    import numpy as np
    
    from skimage import img_as_float
    
    def img_as_float_1_14dev(image):
        imin_in = np.iinfo(image.dtype).min
        imax_in = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
    
        image = image.astype(float)
        image /= imax_in
        return np.asarray(image, float)
    
    def img_as_float_1_14dev_multiply(image):
        imin_in = np.iinfo(image.dtype).min
        imax_in = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
    
        image = image.astype(float)
        image *= (1. / imax_in)
        return np.asarray(image, float)
    
    def img_as_float_let_numpy_choose_multiply(image):
        imax_in = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
        return image * (1. / imax_in)
    
    def img_as_float_let_numpy_choose_divide(image):
        imax_in = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
        return image / imax_in
    
    def img_as_float_preallocate_divide(image):
        imax_in   = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
        image_out = np.empty(shape=image.shape, dtype=float)
        np.divide(image, imax_in, out=image_out, dtype=float)
        return image_out
    
    def img_as_float_preallocate_multiply(image):
        imax_in   = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
        image_out = np.empty(shape=image.shape, dtype=float)
        np.multiply(image, 1/imax_in, out=image_out, dtype=float)
        return image_out
    
    def img_as_float_multiply(image):
        imax_in   = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
        return np.multiply(image, 1/imax_in, dtype=float)
    array_uint8 = np.random.randint(low=0, high=255, size=100*1024*1024, dtype='uint8')
    
    array_uint8 = np.random.randint(low=0, high=255, size=1*1024*1024, dtype='uint8')
    array_uint8 = np.random.randint(low=0, high=255, size=128*1024, dtype='uint8')
    
    %timeit r = img_as_float(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_1_14dev(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_1_14dev_multiply(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_let_numpy_choose_divide(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_let_numpy_choose_multiply(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_preallocate_divide(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_preallocate_multiply(array_uint8)
    %timeit r = img_as_float_multiply(array_uint8)
    ```

13	6	skimage/util/dtype.py

commit 7ace7e8627098b0752cae88646260e85e230a6b6
Author: Lars G <lagru@mailbox.org>
Date:   2018-05-10 16:42:37 +0200

    BUG: Skip prefiltering if neighbors in last dimension aren't connected
    
    Prefiltering in the last dimension based on sample comparison only makes
    sense if these are part of the structuring element (-1 and 1 in
    neighbor_offsets). If this is not the case, simply skip this step and
    evaluate every sample in the image.

commit 51a0e1a93256d0a0b13054893d40ad5b5dc88ba4
Author: Lars G <lagru@mailbox.org>
Date:   2018-05-01 17:51:06 +0200

    ENH: Replace old local_maxima with new algorithm
    
    The test failure in TestExtrema.test_local_extrema_uniform at
    test_extrema.py:214 is expected for dtypes np.uint64 & np.int64.
    This happens because numpy.pad doesn't correctly pad the inverted image.
    This seems to be a bug in NumPy
    (see https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/11027).

commit 7c10263ae3022f4d5313823e763ae918d682837b
Author: Lars G <lagru@mailbox.org>
Date:   2018-04-27 14:36:25 +0200

    Add option to include maxima at borders
    
    Maxima touching the image border are included by simply padding the
    array with its minimal value. Thus a maximum is always at least 1 sample
    away from the image border and will not be omitted.
    
    Furthermore the user can pass in a custom structured element himself
    with the modified argument `selem` (former `connectivity`).
    
    [ci skip]

5	6	skimage/morphology/_extrema_cy.pyx

commit 12a5418b15b05da947bec5db69f9de5055f33a75
Merge: 6f9bbcc6 5bfc90ae
Author: ThomasWalter <thomas.walter@mines-paristech.fr>
Date:   2018-04-25 11:18:18 +0200

    Merge branch 'max_tree' into attribute_operators
    Alternative implementation for attribute operators, based on max-trees.
    This implementation is more versatile, as it allows for non-increasing criteria.
    But for the moment, I only implemented area openings.
    The local maxima detection is slower than the one existing, but it can be interesting when the max-tree is already computed.

commit 4e33ce5310b65a6439ea7dca140375c114172efa
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni.soma@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-04-12 17:16:26 +1000

    Ensure warning to provide bool array is warranted (#2930)
    
    * Ensure warning to provide bool array is warranted
    
    When providing a volume with only two labels,
    morphology.remove_small_objects warns that the user probably meant to
    provide a bool array. However, if the user provides a bool array that
    only has one connected components, the warning still pops up!
    
    This commit ensures that the warning only pops up if the user did *not*
    provide a bool array.
    
    Reported by @husby036 at:
    
    https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image/commit/a2def31fca2dddce920c924fd57a211820e14b45#commitcomment-26398024
    
    * Add test to ensure no warning raised for bool img

1	1	skimage/morphology/misc.py
1	0	skimage/morphology/tests/test_misc.py

commit 3fb8ad3915c686d12fb93bf8b048049601130a35
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2018-04-09 11:57:11 +1000

    Ensure stdev is always nonnegative in _mean_std
    
    For some values, floating point error can cause VarX = E(X^2) - (EX)^2
    to be negative, resulting in NaNs when taking StdX = sqrt(VarX). Here
    we ensure that VarX is nonnegative before taking the square root.

commit db80d0397875964e8c3de579a3951de924b10959
Author: blochl <blochl@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2018-03-05 22:43:24 +0100

    Watershed segmentation: make usable for large arrays (#2967)
    
    * Watershed segmentation: make usable for large arrays
    
    Numbering of indexes is now 64-bit, to allow usage on arrays with more
    than 2**31-1 elements. With volumes as large as (for example) 2048**3,
    which is not an extraordinary size for 3D volumes anymore, 32-bit index
    numbering can not be used.
    
    Additionally, some related quantities are kept 64-bit (and not converted
    to 32-bit, as before) to avoid redundant operations. These quantities
    are not a part of large arrays, so there is no noticeable effect on
    memory usage.
    
    Signed-off-by: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>

7	6	skimage/morphology/_watershed.pyx
7	3	skimage/morphology/watershed.py

Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni.soma@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-02-15 12:35:06 +1100

    Add 3D support to `blob_dog` and `blob_log` (#2854)
    
    * Ported feature.blob_dog and feature.blob_log for 3D images
    * Modified stacking for compatibility with NumPy < 1.10
    * Improved speed of _prune_blobs using cKDTree
    * KDTree instead of cKDTree for scipy 0.9
    * Corrected a bug (distance between blobs) + test and some notations as well
    * Remove outdated check for scipy 0.9
    * Allow computing Hessian matrix determinants for nD images
    * Allow Hessian matrix det and eig computation in nD
    * Use np.stack instead of np.concatenate hack
    * Docstring fixes
    * Use proper deprecation of Hessian eigvals API
    * Bug fix: Hessian eigenvalues in decreasing order
    * Remove guard that was impossible to reach
    * Add 3D Hessian matrix tests

commit d5de26855022127b0090ffaca930c1d6b02f6386
Author: Oleksandr Pavlyk <oleksandr-pavlyk@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2018-01-25 19:10:50 -0600

    Handle NumPy 1.14 API changes (#2935)
    
    * fixed NumPy 1.14 deprecation warning
    
    * replaced remaining instances of deprecated np.issubdtype(dt, float) with np.issubdtype(dt, np.floating)
    
    * repacing issubdtype(dt, np.bool) with intended issubdtype(dt, np.bool_), since the former is interpreted as issubdtype(dt, np.generic) per deprecation warning, clearly unintended here
    
    * issubdtype(dt, 'half') replaced with issubdtype(dt, np.half) per deprecation warning
    
    * replaced issubdtype(dt, np.int) with issubdtype(dt, np.signedinteger) per deperecation warning
    
    * Attempt at replacing use of np.subtract with use of np.logical_xor for arrays of boolean type per NumPy deprecation warning
    
    * Use legacy numpy printing in pytest
    
    * fixed incorrect replacement of np.issubdtype(dt, 'half') with np.issubdtype(dt, np.half). NumPy 1.13 was interperting that as np.issubdtype(dt, np.floating)
    
    * Use view to convert arrays of type np.bool into np.uint8 when passing them to scipy.ndimage functions to work around deprecation warnings in NumPy 1.14 on arithmetic with np.bool arrays
    
    * Added reminedr on pytest doctest workaround to TODO

commit f7d7972079dee5b8d20d4e45e8dae9812a8e38a3
Merge: 02f8d9b9 57c042dc
Author: Gregory R. Lee <grlee77@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-12-01 08:35:52 -0500

    Merge pull request #2878 from blochl/nl_means_fixes
    
    Nl means fixes for large datasets

commit 57c042dc3998c2fa5b70899951d3871d14783c0d
Author: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>
Date:   2017-11-13 14:36:39 +0100

    Restoration: Use fast exponent approximation in NL Means
    
    The NL Means algorithm requires very frequent computation of exponents,
    to calculate the weights. Using this approximation reduces the overall
    calculation time significantly, without a noticeable reduction in accuracy.
    NL Means denoising can take a very long of time on large datasets, so this
    reduction in calculation time is crucial.
    
    The paper which describes this fast approximation algorithm can be found
    here:
    https://schraudolph.org/pubs/Schraudolph99.pdf
    (Nicol N. Schraudolph, 1999)
    
    Another paper, with a slight variation of it, is here:
    http://dx.doi.org/10.1162/089976600300015033
    (Gavin C. Cawley, 2000)
    
    Additional improvements and customizations were made by the author of
    this patch.
    
    Signed-off-by: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>

40	0	skimage/_shared/fast_exp.h
9	6	skimage/restoration/_nl_means_denoising.pyx
2	1	skimage/restoration/setup.py

commit 34f7ca93f833101e2586a3bfb040ca054e167d91
Author: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>
Date:   2017-11-13 14:25:18 +0100

    Restoration: Use double (float64) instead of float32 in NL Means
    
    Usage of float (float32) caused significant noise introduction at higher
    indexes of large datasets. This issue is fixed by working on double
    (float64) data.
    
    Signed-off-by: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>

54	55	skimage/restoration/_nl_means_denoising.pyx

commit 26277a291f9e81b073be125836fa82d972ae36b7
Author: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>
Date:   2017-11-13 14:17:21 +0100

    Restoration: Trivial refactoring in NL Means
    
    Signed-off-by: Leonid Bloch <leonid.bloch@esrf.fr>

commit 43a8a829033c08100d2d1561b73ab306b8343fd3
Author: Gregory R. Lee <grlee77@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-11-01 15:13:29 -0400

    simplify dask code.  revert to simple average again for simplicity
    
    bump dask requirement to 0.9.0 [skip Appveyor]
    
    0.9.0 is the minimum version supporting dask.delayed as used in _cycle_spin.py
    
    remove use of += in cycle_spin.py
    
    += was not giving any practical performance benefit and is not supported by dask.delayed

commit a346268a461ef2a403ed8e8da6e9e446c741e75b
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni.soma@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-10-26 12:47:01 +1100

    Add nD support to image moments computation (#2603)
    
    * Add support for nD image moments
    
    BOOYAH
    
    * Remove no-longer-needed Cython moments
    
    * Remove guard against earlier scipy versions
    
    We now depend on scipy 0.17, so it doesn't make sense to test
    whether the user has 0.9 or greater.
    
    * Fix error in 3D normalized moments
    
    * Remove some unnecessary only2d regionprops
    
    * Minor code cleanups
    
    * Make all moments-dependent regionprops nD
    
    * Make regionprops tests use rc coords
    
    The new moments interface returns results that make sense for
    rc coordinates, returning the transpose only when the old
    interface is used. Regionprops uses these extensively so it will
    be massively disruptive to issue warnings for all of them.
    
    * Make deprecation path for xy coords in regionprops
    
    * Fix test_draw to use non-warning regionprops
    
    * Check for valid coordinates argument
    
    * Add deprecation and release notes for nd moments
    
    * Make inertia_tensor available outside regionprops
    
    * Clarify implication of regionprops xy deprecation
    
    * Fix integer division bug in 2.7
    
    * Add missing newline in inertia_tensor docstring
    
    * Add clarifying comments and docstrings
    
    * Tweak deprecation warning logic

commit 1740b2e77086b4e07843664985eb807923ed99dd
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2017-10-02 13:13:02 +1100

    Label watershed pixels at push if compactness=0
    
    See discussion at https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image/issues/2636
    
    """
    When compactness is not a factor, the first version [labeling at push
    time] is correct, because the labelling is determined solely by which
    label gets there first. (If they get there at the same time, then it's
    arbitrary and you might as well give it to the label that pushes first.)
    But when compactness is a factor, labelling at push-time is a bug,
    because a different neighbor could get there "later" but actually be
    "closer" when compactness is factored in.
    """

2	0	skimage/morphology/_watershed.pyx

commit 95a5c0beef50ef7176b1a92afe49fc154a498a65
Merge: e8405d36 be89b80d
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni.soma@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-09-24 12:12:05 +1000

    Merge pull request #2802 from ahojnnes/downsample-image
    
    Add Gaussian filter-based antialiasing to resize
    
    Previously, we only provided functions to resize/rescale images with
    pure interpolation. This results in aliasing effects when reducing the
    image size. The new functions properly account for this effect by
    applying a Gaussian filter prior to interpolation.

commit e6443867892ee954c7fe7bdcc2d62e7f4f248214
Author: François Boulogne <sciunto@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2017-08-02 20:37:52 +0200

    Refactor and improve `montage2d`  into `montage` (#2626)
    
    - Move montage2d to skimage.util, add generalized montage function, add comprehensive testing
    - Add border_padding
    
    The ```border_padding``` argument adds a border around each tile in the montage so they can be more easily differentiated. Particularly helpful when looking at multidimensional weights where boundaries are not obvious.

commit 88a9111e519a350c5521f65aef98f6bba89bdbb2
Author: RoseZhao <rosezhao@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2017-04-21 12:20:01 -0700

    Website updates (documentation build) (#2585)
    
    Various updates to the website (documentation part).
    
    1. Delete "Navigation", "Previous" and "Next" from documentation.
    2. Fix the alignment issue with Python and Jupyter notebook download in gallery
       examples (the buttons appeared underneath, instead of next to one another) and
       change their color to blue (from weird yellow).
    3. Change the title of "API Reference" to "API Reference for scikit-image Version
       x.y".
    4. For each entry listed in the gallery page, remove the gradient (more modern look)
       and add a dark gray border around it.
    5. For each topic in the user guide, add a table of contents in the sidebar.
    6. Remove gradient of gallery entries on mouse hover.
    7. For each topic in API Reference, move the "source" button to the very right and
       enlarge the sentence next to it to make the version very clear.
    8. Add a hyperlink to "Download for Development" that leads to "Installation from
       Source".
    9. List all submodules in skimage at the top of API Reference.
    10. Remove "Versions" sidebar and add a prominent block with current version and
        a link to scikit-image/docs for other versions.
    11. Remove version list
    12. Restructure API listing
    13. Delete contents sidepanel

commit 1168c777d2b1598212be81a93b8bf444f18c7007
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefanv@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2017-03-01 16:12:36 -0800

    Simplify implementation of `threshold_minimum`
    
    I removed the `bias` argument, which was not well documented.  For now, the
    algorithm is simple: smooth the histogram until there are only two peaks; then
    return the lowest histogram point between these positions.

12	32	doc/examples/xx_applications/plot_thresholding.py

commit bd58e2f0e03443ce2e0cd0aa418fbfce9b9295f0
Merge: c61cde7e 4f809324
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni.soma@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-03-02 10:30:43 +1100

    Merge pull request #2547 from BioGeek/patch-1
    
    Replace GRIN URL with Flickr URL

commit 0b8e40a6a410b2212de6192421ac8736b5b24a65
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefanv@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2017-03-01 11:35:02 -0800

    Have `threshold_minimum` return identical results on i686 and x86_64
    
    Due to a difference in behavior of `scipy.ndimage.filters.uniform_filter1d`,
    the results also vary in `threshold_minimum`.  This PR modifies the filter to
    operate on 32-bit floating point numbers (instead of integers),
    and casting the output to int afterwards.

3	3	skimage/filters/tests/test_thresholding.py

commit 00d9947509f49678577e1cc0acf35458796cf935
Author: Ole Streicher <github@liska.ath.cx>
Date:   2016-12-25 14:39:29 +0100

    Fix shape type for histogram
    
    The number of bins is always an integer, independently of the image data type. This fixes a build problem with numpy 1.12, [in Debian](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=848112#40):
    ``
    `======================================================================
    ERROR: skimage.filters.rank.tests.test_rank.test_all
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nose/case.py", line 197, in runTest
        self.test(*self.arg)
      File "/build/skimage-0.12.3/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/skimage/filters/rank/tests/test_rank.py", line 16, in test_all
        check_all()
      File "/build/skimage-0.12.3/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/skimage/_shared/testing.py", line 232, in inner
        result = func(*args, **kwargs)
      File "/build/skimage-0.12.3/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/skimage/filters/rank/tests/test_rank.py", line 89, in check_all
        rank.windowed_histogram(image, selem))
      File "/build/skimage-0.12.3/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/skimage/filters/rank/generic.py", line 986, in windowed_histogram
        pixel_size=n_bins)
      File "/build/skimage-0.12.3/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/skimage/filters/rank/generic.py", line 90, in _apply_vector_per_pixel
        pixel_size=pixel_size)
      File "/build/skimage-0.12.3/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/skimage/filters/rank/generic.py", line 53, in _handle_input
        out = np.empty(image.shape+(pixel_size,), dtype=out_dtype)
    TypeError: 'numpy.float64' object cannot be interpreted as an index
    
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------
    Ran 1383 tests in 181.697s
    
    FAILED (SKIP=54, errors=1)
    ```

commit cb5288a4658f453c0f1dfa9e20f4dd41962cebbc
Author: Robin Wilson <robin@rtwilson.com>
Date:   2016-08-26 11:40:52 +0100

    Added more specific check for image shape in threshold_otsu warning
    
    Currently a warning is emitted from threshold_otsu if image.shape[-1]
    is 3 or 4, as this suggests the image may be a RGB or RGBA image. However,
    this warning is often raised unnecessarily. For example, the following
    shapes of array raise this warning even though they are unlikely to be a RGB
    image:
    
    (500, 4)
    (4, 3)
    (3,)
    (4,)
    
    Modifying the code to check whether len(image.shape) > 2 means that none
    of these are caught, but all images that may potentially be RGB are still caught.
    
    I'm aware that the logic may be to raise warnings liberally, but it can cause problems,
    particularly for people running with 'warnings as errors' - and I think this alteration
    still catches all genuine RGB(A) images.

1	1	skimage/filters/thresholding.py

commit fc2089af325e204841ea6af0b39ea3499c7e6e73
Author: AbdealiJK <abdealikothari@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-07-06 22:55:51 +0530

    colorconv: Add rgba2rgb()
    
    rgba2rgb() is a conversion function which takes in a background RGB
    color which is used to alpha blend with an RGBA image in the foreground.
    The default value for this background is white (255, 255, 255).

Author: AbdealiJK <abdealikothari@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-06-23 09:25:51 +0530

    color.colorconv: Fix documentation of rgb2gray()
    
    The working of rgb2gray() has been modified, and it now works
    with both 3D and 4D arrays and appropriately finds the luminance
    image of the given image. The documnetation does not mention the
    4D array support and this commit modifies the documentation to
    mention this.

commit 89136157bb89d0a463bc9b1f4be323913c716570
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefanv@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2016-03-06 22:40:02 -0800

    Remove lena image from test suite.
    
    Results from the morphology module were compared against output from the
    corresponding MATLAB functions, as applied to the lena test image.  This image
    does not conform to the Debian Free Software Guidelines and had to be removed.
    The output is now tested against results generated with the current version of
    scikit-image (0.12.0), which is known to be correct due to the comparison
    described above.

commit 7caf88f6eef203f94ca370225b3ae714db644160
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefanv@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2016-03-02 18:09:09 -0800

    Fix assertion in novice test for older numpy versions
    
    For older versions of numpy, `assert_equal(a, b)` failed for arbitrary objects
    `a` and `b` even if they had ``__eq__`` defined.  This is now fixed, but the
    test is changed to use ``assert_true(a == b)`` to be backward compatible.

2	1	skimage/novice/tests/test_novice.py

commit 9e9207c718be4f8c27f432bff8ac86123cb30b1a
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefanv@berkeley.edu>
Date:   2016-03-02 17:32:04 -0800

    Catch known Matplotlib warnings
    
    `tight_layout` is not supported on all backends, so Matplotlib may raise a
    warning, saying it is falling back to the Agg backend.  Since we use the
    'Template' backend in our tests, this warning pops up from time to time.

19	7	skimage/io/tests/test_mpl_imshow.py

commit dc702a83eeab95f65ae398dd8d5ec5d9b597f34e
Author: Evgeni Burovski <evgeny.burovskiy@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-05 12:43:29 +0000

    TST: skel3d: redo 3D test images
    
    Remove ad-hoc images from morphology/tests/data folder.
    Add a FIJI generated image to skimage/data.
    
    The image was generated via
    >>> img = binary_blobs(32, 0.05, n_dim=3, seed=1234)
    >>> img = img.astype(np.uint8)*255
    >>> img = img[:-2, ...]
    
    then saved as a sequence of png frames, read into FIJI as an image sequence,
    and skeletonized via Plugins -> Skeletonize (2D/3D).

commit 5c03f2aff5d131d85914d49732b187fc707e57df
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2015-12-15 10:56:04 +1100

    Bug: not all edges found by asymmetric footprint
    
    If we have a label image:
    
    [[1, 2],
     [3, 4]]
    
    Then the footprint:
    
     [[0, 0, 0],
      [0, 1, 1],
      [0, 1, 1]]
    
    will not discover the edge (2, 3), even though that edge should be
    present when `connectivity=2`.
    
    This commit fixes the bug by using a complete footprint, without the
    top/left surfaces zeroed out.
    
    See also:
    https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image/pull/1826#issuecomment-164597442

4	23	skimage/future/graph/rag.py

commit 86052d67bd66da79199500f1f0858985c2f2ccc2

commit 4deeb1f802bca6a849f1077a7371655cd296557f
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2015-12-14 19:06:43 +1100

    Move max_id logic to top of RAG constructor
    
    max_id is used during RAG building iteration, resulting in an error if
    it is not defined ahead of the generic_filter stage.

4	6	skimage/future/graph/rag.py

commit 53d3154f09d77bcd6ef9efae93bd6bba95f8df54
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2015-12-14 18:57:29 +1100

    Use a strided 1-element array as dummy filter out
    
    When using generic_filter to build a graph, the numerical filter
    output is actually ignored. Building a full array, even of the
    smallest dtype, was wasteful. Using stride_tricks solves this by
    creating a single-element buffer into which all output is fed.

4	1	skimage/future/graph/rag.py

commit 040a53456d933f8587dbdcfb093b3bc03db2c5e9
Author: Kevin Keraudren <kevin@klarismo.com>
Date:   2015-12-02 08:58:16 +0000

    Merged LineModel3D with LineModel in order to form a unified model.
    
     - model.params holds the legacy params (2D representation),
     - model.new_params holds the true ND line representation.
    
    The proposed LineModel behaves identically as the implementation in master in the 2D case. In the 3D case, it behaves similarly to the previously proposed LineModel3D, as long as new_params is used instead of params. This implementation thus takes advantage that the 2D case is a special case of the ND general model.

2	2	doc/examples/plot_ransac3D.py
1	2	skimage/measure/__init__.py
99	111	skimage/measure/fit.py
19	21	skimage/measure/tests/test_fit.py

    Added new functionality to remove small holes from images.
    
    This is currently working with **kwargs except for inplace
    which I cannot get working. It works with arrays of type int
    but returns an array of type bool. Possibly in future add
    labelling for arrays of type int. A UserWarning is produced
    when using arrays of type int which seems to work normally
    but the test created for this does not pick up the warning.
    
    Any assistance on these issues would be helpful. I started
    this at EuroScipy 2015 and this fixes issue #1642

commit 81ea7a6e342d805cc02629369870641b4a3166fa
Author: Gregory R. Lee <gregory.lee@cchmc.org>
Date:   2015-08-13 22:11:04 -0400

    MAINT: All modes in _shared.interpolation.pxd were changed to be consistent with numpy.pad naming conventions.  Specifically 'nearest' was changed to 'edge' and 'mirror' was changed to 'reflect'.  All functions with a mode argument that rely on these functions had their inputs changed accordingly.  For now there is a deprecation warning if the user supplies mode 'nearest'.  Mode 'mirror' never appeared in an official release of skimage and so has no corresponding deprecation warning.

32	19	skimage/_shared/interpolation.pxd

    BLD: __SKIMAGE_SETUP__ global variable for detecting build
    
    The __SKIMAGE_SETUP__ global variable is set to True if skimage is being build
    from the main setup.py file, False if not.  This behavior is modeled after a
    similar setup in scikit-learn

    Update measure.regionprops.weighted_moments_central doc
    
    The documentation is misleading. In fact, the code does do what a user would expect: use the weighted centroid coordinates, not the centroid coordinates. It's one word, but it's an important one!

    the doctests.

58	59	skimage/feature/blob.py

commit c86c6effe8ead802e01a8fa83aefc7bc945f2662
Author: Daniel Wennberg <daniel.wennberg@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-05-02 16:52:44 +0200

    Fix tests for #1257
    
    The test of blob_doh() set an unrealistically strict threshold for the
    accuracy of the estimated blob radius, causing the test to fail with the
    true floating-point value (previously, the test passed only because
    sigma was truncated to integer). Increasing the threshold fixes the
    problem.

1	1	skimage/feature/tests/test_blob.py

commit 9de5a4557c9d32a62eac8c7d19028abad8b710b0
Author: Gustav Larsson <gustav.m.larsson@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-04-20 14:35:57 -0500

    Added test for buffer overflow in slic.
    
    As with all buffer overflows, it is hard to make a test that
    consistently triggers tests the behavior. This test does not work for me
    through the test_slic.py file, but it works in isolation.

7	0	skimage/segmentation/tests/test_slic.py

commit 841da2b3f88b47737cf43f7c98d7689ff86d86fe
Author: Gustav Larsson <gustav.m.larsson@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-04-20 09:39:38 -0500

    Fixed crashing bug in slic.
    
    The enforce connectivity step of slic runs a BFS and puts the
    results in coord_list. This coord_list has room for max_size elements,
    which is easily overrun if there is a large connected element. This
    change limits the BFS to max_size, so that if a connected area is bigger
    than max_size, it will be split up instead of the program crashing.

3	1	skimage/segmentation/_slic.pyx

commit b6f2125e71ff6ba288c8d887cb6b1a1c9b7ec846
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2015-03-31 00:24:23 +1100

    Allow keyword arguments to imsave for PIL plugin
    
    Certain formats allow additional arguments, such as `compress=` for
    TIFF or `quality=` for JPEG. Without this patch, the plugin simply
    does not allow these arguments to be passed.

1	0	skimage/measure/fit.py

commit eb6c3ede3824da2b44fa3bafda81844366c813ff
Author: Johannes Schönberger <jsch@demuc.de>
Date:   2015-03-06 23:47:08 -0500

    Fix RANSAC for invalid model estimation and confidence corner case
    
    Previously, estimators did not return whether the model estimation
    was successful. RANSAC now tests whether the estimation was
    successful and skips invalid models.
    
    When the confidence/stop_probability of RANSAC was set to 1,
    the iteration was falsely terminated early instead of running for
    the maximum number of iterations.

commit 242dbf9b2bc02cddda942c1f0a0b03151eb232f2
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2015-01-12 12:24:17 +1100

    Don't outline boundaries by default
    
    mark_boundaries used to draw outlines by default. This was necessary
    partly because of the asymmetric way boundaries were being drawn. Now,
    boundaries are either thick or drawn around background or drawn with
    subpixel precision, so I suggest that outlines are less needed.

Author: Jonathan Helmus <jjhelmus@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-01-21 16:23:50 -0600

    unwrap_phase returns masked array when image is masked
    
    With commit e3b84ed the unwrap_phase function would always return an ndarray
    even when image was masked.  This restores the pre-e3b84ed behavior of
    returning a masked array when the image is masked.

commit fac8fde9dca1b2c37f5615468944d44c6e826e19
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2014-12-15 21:41:11 +1100

    Overhaul matplotlib imshow plugin
    
    - images are displayed within their native dtype range,
    - unless they are outside of their range (e.g. a float image with
      values greater than 1) or they are of an unsupported dtype (e.g.
      a uint64 image), in which case the dynamic range of the display
      corresponds to the image range,
    - which is also done for images with extremely low contrast for their
      native range (e.g. float images in [1e-7, 5e-7].
    
    In the latter two cases, a colorbar is also displayed and a warning is
    raised.
    
    Finally, we return the axes object on which the image is plotted, to
    enable further plotting in the matplotlib new OO style.

1	1	skimage/io/_io.py
40	1	skimage/io/_plugins/matplotlib_plugin.py

commit 8f4d0247b56ae157e8486c37e38992015e55ac3e
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2014-12-15 15:42:54 +1100

    Add docstring to matplotlib imshow plugin
    
    The image is now named as an argument, and the axes are returned, in
    keeping with matplotlib convention.

commit 5f89395fcd3096fee43b3565eb9ba534b1cd1975
Author: Emmanuelle Gouillart <emmanuelle.gouillart@nsup.org>
Date:   2014-02-23 18:30:58 +0100

    Modified indentation in places (PEP8)

10	10	skimage/filter/_nl_means_denoising.pyx

commit a5ed4acf86047a492f7e7df0c6dc6034cd8735f0
Author: Emmanuelle Gouillart <emmanuelle.gouillart@nsup.org>
Date:   2014-02-23 13:28:27 +0100

    Some improvements of non-local means denoising:
    
    - denoising RGB is now possible, and "colored patches" are then compared
    
    - the main function is now in a pure Python file so that default values
      of kw arguments are visible in the help
    
    - reduced the number of computations of patches bound (but this doesn't
      change much the total speed).
    
    - added an example for the gallery
    
    I also played with functions that could replace the exponential by a
    faster and less precise function, but it turns out that most of the time
    is spent in additions and multiplications when computing the distance
    between two patches.

41	0	doc/examples/plot_nonlocal_means.py
164	89	skimage/filter/_nl_means_denoising.pyx
74	0	skimage/filter/nl_means_denoising.py
169	0	skimage/filter/tests/test_denoise.py

Author: Almar Klein <almar.klein@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-11-21 22:36:04 +0100

    Update docs for img_as_ubyte
    
    The line in `img_as_ubyte` needs correction; ubyte cannot hold negative data. From a quick experiment it seems like both `img_as_uint` and `img_as_ubyte` clip negative values (and not shift them to the positive domain).

Date:   2014-11-06 10:27:43 +1100

    Raise meaningful error in reconstruct w bad method
    
    If a method other than 'erosion' or 'dilation' was passed, an
    `UnboundLocalVariable` error for `pad_value` was raised, which made it
    difficult to determine the source of the error. Now, an eloquent
    `ValueError` is raised instead.
    
    See #1218.

9	1	skimage/morphology/tests/test_misc.py

commit a2def31fca2dddce920c924fd57a211820e14b45
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2014-09-30 14:51:00 +1000

    Warn users of `remove_small_objects` about type
    
    When input type is `int`, we assume that the image is pre-labeled.
    However, when only 0 and 1 are present, it may be that the user expects
    us to treat it as a binary image. We don't, but now issue a warning
    that they might want to use a bool image.
    
    Fixes #1178.

5	0	skimage/morphology/misc.py

commit da93619e59d3aac0ec4945ca5d4646beea770009
Author: Geoffrey French <frondit1985@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-08-31 22:25:45 +0100

    Fixed some issues with the new windowed_histogram function in filter.rank.
    It used to be able to output uint8 histogram, whose max pixel counts of 255 could easily overflow. Addressed by limiting the output type to float.
    Normalized histograms are now generated, otherwise behaviour is unpredictable at boundaries or when pixels are not permitted by a mask.
    The new optional n_bins parameter allows the caller to specify the size of the histogram generated. Having it fixed to image.max()+1 could result in feature vectors being shorter than desired just due to a value not being used in an image.
    An example has been added to the docs, that demonstrates the application of windows histograms in object matching; a single coin is extracted and found by chi squared histogram matching.

129	0	doc/examples/plot_windowed_histogram.py
20	11	skimage/filter/rank/generic.py
8	2	skimage/filter/rank/generic_cy.pyx
25	12	skimage/filter/rank/tests/test_rank.py

commit 278a0d6862e25a479f38a29f5451f33232fdc3cf
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2014-07-28 12:38:34 +1000

    Bug fix: nbins can be >256 in threshold_isodata
    
    The threshold_isodata function created an arange of values up to the
    number of bins, but gave it type np.uint8, limiting the number of bins
    to 256.
    
    Fixes #1085.

commit 7a074d5dd165536cb05fd87ea94a29510edac1a7
Author: Charles Harris <charlesr.harris@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-07-04 20:04:32 -0600

    BUG: Fix slicing error revealed by numpy 1.9.0.
    
    Numpy 1.9.0 no longer allows oversize data to be assigned to a
    boolean indexed 1-d array by discarding excess elements.
    
    Closes #1050.

commit b9a7445296a650c7639efe1f71c737ccfa1630e6
Author: Kevin Murray <spam@kdmurray.id.au>
Date:   2014-06-27 21:26:58 +1000

    [skimg.io._plugins.freeimage_plugin] fix segfault
    
    I have moved the freeimage error handler callback function to the module
    namespace to prevent it being garbage collected. See the following for
    more info on this quirk of ctypes:
    http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12995925/how-to-prevent-functype-from-being-collected
    https://github.com/JohannesBuchner/PyMultiNest/issues/5
    
    This also changes the way FreeImage errors are handled. If an exception
    is raised in a callback, it will not propagate beyond ctypes internals.
    Now, we use a callback that sets a global variable to indicate error. We
    then check for error and reset the error string to NULL every time the
    C api is called. This is the only way we can both:
     a) Not segfault on freeimage error
     b) Pass the freeimage error to the user
     c) raise RuntimeError()

49	13	skimage/io/_plugins/freeimage_plugin.py

commit c08a6876d647448d520ad8893065a8baac4be46c
Author: Vighnesh Birodkar <vighneshbirodkar@gmail.com>

commit 132aa8bbd3baf56e4455e75cf2766ed59346d67f
Author: Stefan van der Walt <stefan@sun.ac.za>
Date:   2014-04-27 02:08:33 +0200

    Add all_warnings context manager
    
    The context manager searches for __warningregistry__ entries that
    Python leaves all over the place, clearing them, thereby ensuring
    that warnings will always be raised.  This is necessary for the test
    suite to detect warnings even if they were raised before under
    the "once" filter.

2	0	skimage/util/__init__.py
60	0	skimage/util/_warnings.py

commit e6fc72011fb6bf2db62e2d0072b7dd007d515399
Author: jaimefrio <jaime.frio@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-03-11 00:47:15 -0700

    BUG: wrong search for pivot in `quicker_sort`
    
    This PR corrects an error in the search for the existence of a distinct
    pivot for sorting in the `quicker_sort` routines. This could lead to
    `quicker_sort` wrongly believing that all items in a subarray are equal and
    hence require no sorting.
    
    While this doesn't explain #835 and #902, it may be related.

    `linewidth=1` works transparently!

commit 00f4d38c2c743cfc3f5b22c286cb3fbce049fda0
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2014-01-29 22:47:52 +1100

    Polish coordinate system
    
    It's important to distinguish between pixels and points. A square set
    of points belongs to one pixel. When users type `linewidth=3`, they
    usually mean a line 3 pixels wide. The distance between the pixel
    center points, then, is 2.

15	5	skimage/measure/profile.py

commit 011409f66a7e3736b6310e6b1cc12f52da9f9763
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2014-01-24 16:53:14 +1100

    Add profile_line to measure package
    
    The profile_line function is currently part of the skimage LineProfile
    plugin. However, it's useful in non-interactive contexts, and importing
    it from the viewer is awkward, mostly hidden, and depends on PyQt for
    no good reason. By moving the function to `skimage.measure`, it is
    usable in many more contexts.

commit 32c4a80b32d16c6741c2c89f9cfbe7271bfa0dfa
Author: Almar Klein <almar.klein@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-12-13 14:00:33 +0100

    update-mcp: Add MCP_Flexible subclass.
    
    This class adds a public def-method for the private cdef-method hooks.
    This allows users to influence the behavior of the MCP algorithm by
    subclassing it in pure Python.

58	0	skimage/graph/_mcp.pyx

commit 8fe7416d41a3c93f06e252cd39400707f14474f6
Author: Almar Klein <almar.klein@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-12-13 13:58:44 +0100

    update-mcp: Add MCP_Connect class
    
    This class finds the connections between the given seed points. This is
    a bit similar to finding connections between start and end points, except
    now start- and endpoints are the same.

124	0	skimage/graph/_mcp.pyx

commit 798bea72514b542561c6890c47bedc959bf92e66
Author: Almar Klein <almar.klein@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-12-13 13:52:52 +0100

    update-mcp: Refactor MCP algorithm in prep for MCP subclasses
    
    Installed a few hooks to allow more flexibility in subclasses, refactored
    traceback() to allow obtaining tracebacks fast during front evolution, and
    moved some initializations to reset().
    
    Full list:
    * integer division in calculating indices
    * traceback_offsets use -2 for uninitialized, -1 for seed point. In that
      we we can distinguish between these two cases in traceback()
    * Clearing of traceback_offset, cumulative_costs, pushing start positions
      into the heap, are now all done in reset()
    * Reset is called every time that find_cost is called.
    * Add hook _goal_reached()
    * Add hook _examine_neighbor()
    * Add hook _update_node()
    * Replace while loop with a for-loop to prevent infinite looping in case of a bug.
    * Split traceback() in two functions to allow getting a flat traceback fast.
      traceback() calles these two private functions and behaves as just before.

7	0	skimage/graph/_mcp.pxd
138	46	skimage/graph/_mcp.pyx

commit 280fadff39239c0597a909782b197b318c71a88a
Author: Almar Klein <almar.klein@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-10-24 16:13:35 +0200

    MCP: refactored to use typed memoryviews
    
    The arrays are stored on the mcp object, so that they can
    be used in methods as well. Will use that to make MCP more
    flexibel.

Date:   2013-10-28 14:50:05 +0100

    Fix the bad results of unsupervised deconvolution.
    
    The initial implementation was simplified to reduce the number of
    local variable. Consequently the parameter data.size was wrong. It was
    the size of the fourier spectrum, with hermitian property, instead of
    the real space size. This should work.
    
    In addition the PSF is now normalized.

commit 33aedfd9aabcb0c55edec06c3334e0031e4fb1ee
Author: François Orieux <orieux@iap.fr>
Date:   2013-10-25 23:44:44 +0200

    Add deconvolution module to skimage.
    
    This module add three function to skimage. The `wiener` function is a
    simple wiener deconvolution. The `unsupervised_wiener` is a more
    sophisticated wiener deconvolution with automatic estimation of
    regularisation parameters. The third function is a literal traduction
    in python of the rychardson lucy deconvolution of wikipedia.

commit f53a4e0764583a4f0f074efb466db4cf242b204c
Author: Jostein Bø Fløystad <jostein.floystad@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-16 12:40:52 +0200

    unwrap: Add naive 1D unwrapper.
    
    The naive 1D unwrapper does not support masked arrays because the
    1D unwrapping problem has an infite number of solutions when faced with
    missing data. Wrap around is not implemented because 1D phase unwrapping
    must start at a certain pixel, and there will always be a risk of a
    discontinuity there, wrap around or not.

3	0	bento.info
22	0	skimage/exposure/_unwrap_1d.pyx
3	0	skimage/exposure/setup.py
11	1	skimage/exposure/tests/test_unwrap.py
25	8	skimage/exposure/unwrap.py

16	0	skimage/viewer/plugins/overlayplugin.py

commit 7774a76eea757b7f84ddf4b03ba74a1ed61a6884
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2013-10-31 14:46:04 +1100

    Add plugin return values for ImageViewer
    
    The model supported is that plugins can return an overlay, some data,
    or both. Each plugin therefore returns an `(overlay, data)` tuple in
    which each element can be `None`.
    
    To allow return values, the plugin need only override the `output`
    method defined in the base Plugin class.
    
    See discussions here:
    https://groups.google.com/d/msg/scikit-image/0nkJM-WguXA/iqogBABa748J
    and here:
    https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image/pull/805

17	0	skimage/viewer/plugins/base.py
1	0	skimage/viewer/viewers/core.py

Date:   2013-10-28 18:29:46 +1100

    Modify mpl_image_to_rgba to allow RGB input image
    
    mpl_image_to_rgba produces a image of shape (M, N, 3, 4) when the input
    image is already RGB. This is understandably confusing for downstream
    processes, and this commit fixes it.

commit e75126a4d84a8ec8efe4d704aaabebdcdfa6567c
Author: cgohlke <cgohlke@uci.edu>
Date:   2013-10-15 00:42:40 -0700

    TST: Fix RuntimeError: data type not supported on Python 2.6
    
    On Python >=2.7, C extensions that use integer format codes with the PyArg_Parse* family of functions will raise a TypeError exception instead of triggering a DeprecationWarning (Python 2.6). The RuntimeError is raised by ndimage for unsupported array data types.

2	1	skimage/measure/tests/test_regionprops.py

Merge: 4b0cf8d2 961c47e8

commit 1de6d93850e221aaac71fe845bec47aad0e21f0a
Author: Josh Warner (Mac) <warner.joshua@mayo.edu>
Date:   2013-10-13 13:00:40 -0500

    DOC: Change sampling kwarg name to spacing in marching_cubes
    
    The preference is to follow VTK's convention for anisotropic
    rectangularly sampled data, using the keyword `spacing` rather
    than `sampling`. This change converts the last remaining use of
    `sampling` in scikit-image to `spacing`.

commit de42ba831a125db2913545a364fd14989cb5db83
Author: Josh Warner (Mac) <warner.joshua@mayo.edu>
Date:   2013-10-11 01:53:15 -0500

    FIX: Fix and improve Poisson random noise generator
    
    The Poissson generator now works.
    
    The improved Poisson generator now infers the bit depth of the image
    after conversion to a floating point image, by analyzing the unique
    values present and finding the next power of two. This value is then
    used to scale the floating point image up, after which Poisson
    noise is generated, and then image is then scaled back down.

29	8	skimage/util/noise.py
11	1	skimage/util/tests/test_random_noise.py

Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <juan.n@unimelb.edu.au>
Date:   2013-10-09 09:28:38 +0000

    Fix join_segmentations example using img_as_float
    
    data.coins() returns a ubyte image in Python 2.7.x but a float32 image
    in Python 3.x. This ensures that the image always has the same type for
    the rest of the example.

commit fc15f75f8dc45302a411307896255822f408a92c
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni@janelia.hhmi.org>
Date:   2013-10-05 14:27:51 +1000

    Monkey-patch UmfpackContext __del__
    
    By putting the failing statement in a try: except: clause, the
    exception is caught and the error message is silenced.
    
    See
    https://groups.google.com/d/msg/scikit-image/FrM5IGP6wh4/1hp-FtVZmfcJ
    and
    http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13977970/ignore-exceptions-printed-to-stderr-in-del/13977992?noredirect=1#comment28386412_13977992

11	0	skimage/segmentation/random_walker_segmentation.py

commit 610a0d1793f1b3fb91544c1921311ecf20ff355d
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni@janelia.hhmi.org>
Date:   2013-09-16 17:49:07 +1000

    Add support for list sigma input in SLIC
    
    Previously, having a different `sigma` for different dimensions
    required an array input. This allows the user to use a simple list,
    which gets converted to an array internally.
    
    Importantly, it removes a very unhelpful error:
    
    ```python
    >>> im = np.random.rand(10, 20)
    >>> from skimage import segmentation as seg
    Exception AttributeError: "'UmfpackContext' object has no attribute '_symbolic'" in <bound method UmfpackContext.__del__ of <scipy.sparse.linalg.dsolve.umfpack.umfpack.UmfpackContext object at 0x1045ff5d0>> ignored
    
    >>> s = seg.slic(im, 2, sigma=[2, 1])
    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
    <ipython-input-3-689b36a2f0ef> in <module>()
    ----> 1 s = seg.slic(im, 2, sigma=[2, 1])
    
    /Users/nuneziglesiasj/venv/skimdev2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/scikit_image-0.9dev-py2.7-macosx-10.5-x86_64.egg/skimage/segmentation/slic_superpixels.pyc in slic(image, n_segments, compactness, max_iter, sigma, multichannel, convert2lab, ratio)
        106     if not isinstance(sigma, coll.Iterable):
        107         sigma = np.array([sigma, sigma, sigma])
    --> 108     if (sigma > 0).any():
        109         sigma = list(sigma) + [0]
        110         image = ndimage.gaussian_filter(image, sigma)
    
    AttributeError: 'bool' object has no attribute 'any'
    ```

4	2	skimage/segmentation/slic_superpixels.py
11	0	skimage/segmentation/tests/test_slic.py

commit 06e99a537a314c88731324acb4aa0ba4bdc8bf48
Merge: bc2f23d1 ea1566ff
Author: Johannes Schönberger <jsch@demuc.de>
Date:   2013-09-15 23:37:25 -0700

    Merge pull request #5 from jni/slic-speed-fix-dims
    
    Fix image dimension sanitizing at function start

commit ea1566fffb2cd08e7632be8032fd60977f30a1e2
Author: Juan Nunez-Iglesias <jni@janelia.hhmi.org>
Date:   2013-09-16 16:02:24 +1000

    Fix image dimension sanitizing at function start
    
    `np.atleast_3d` will add a singleton dimension at the end of an array
    if needed. This is not the correct thing to do if `multichannel=False`
    based on the subsequent lines. If the input image was 2D with shape
    `(40, 50)` and `multichannel=False`, then `np.atleast_3d` gives it
    shape `(40, 50, 1)`, and then, because `multichannel=False`, the rest
    of the code gives it shape `(40, 50, 1, 1)`. This results in the final
    returned array having shape `(40, 50, 1)` instead of the desired
    `(40, 50)`.
    
    This commit fixes that and updates the test to detect this failure.

16	15	skimage/segmentation/slic_superpixels.py
2	0	skimage/segmentation/tests/test_slic.py

commit 082586c10cec63d2e8e8c0a4b1423c0f7b2850ae
Author: Emmanuelle Gouillart <emmanuelle.gouillart@nsup.org>
Date:   2013-08-25 14:50:55 +0200

    Added a wrapper around ndimage's Gaussian filter
    
    This version of the Gaussian filter
    
     * uses 'nearest' as the default boundary mode. This can be discussed,
       but I had the impression that for images this is the most relevant
       mode ('extending' boundaries)
    
     * has a `multichannel` keyword, so that each color channel can be
       filtered separately. For now no attempt is made at guessing whether
       the image has color channels or not.

2	0	skimage/filter/__init__.py
91	0	skimage/filter/_gaussian.py
29	0	skimage/filter/tests/test_gaussian.py

    The code
       180 / orientations
    performs integral division in python < 3,

    passing. This is ok, as the reconstruction circle is now larger, meaning
    larger errors should be expected. Moreover, the test in question uses
    random data, and changing the seed causes greater changes in accuracy
    than the amount the test criterion was relaxed by.

4	6	skimage/transform/radon_transform.py
3	3	skimage/transform/tests/test_radon_transform.py

commit 2bfaafd9e2bdc5470c1c38a1cf568f49d0f00077
Author: Jostein Bø Fløystad <jostein.floystad@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-13 19:31:43 +0200

    Radon transform: Redefine projection center for sinograms.
    
    This definition is chosen because it is simple to express in the
    documentation. No changes in accuracy are to be expected, but comparing
    sinograms and reconstructions before and after this commit will give
    different results in the cases where ``circle=False`` for ``radon`` or
    ``iradon``.

11	7	skimage/transform/radon_transform.py

2	3	skimage/transform/radon_transform.py

commit 643a1bc1f58dc6015446d97a63977c5f4d5a4c2c
Author: Jostein Bø Fløystad <jostein.floystad@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-06 18:29:05 +0200

    iradon: Add test for cubic interpolation.

7	6	skimage/transform/tests/test_radon_transform.py

commit b90ba783ef5bc483078a2522cd21b683a0761b69
Author: Jostein Bø Fløystad <jostein.floystad@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-06 18:27:08 +0200

    iradon: Only allow interpolation methods working well.
    
    Of the interpolation methods provided by scipy.interpolate.interp1d,
    only cubic has been found to work well with the tests in skimage (other
    methods are either identical to linear or nearest, or they produce bad
    reconstructions).

3	5	skimage/transform/radon_transform.py

commit 2be327815ebd6e8a6694e016871d9bcafe7ee55c
Author: Jostein Bø Fløystad <jostein.floystad@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-06 17:28:49 +0200

    radon: Use numpy.interp/scipy.interpolate.
    
    Scipy supports all interpolation kinds (nearest, linear) we need, while
    numpy supports only linear interpolation. The numpy interpolation is
    substantially faster, so this is used even though it complicates the
    code slightly.

20	21	skimage/transform/radon_transform.py

commit 5955e4e612b7efdd3eafc0f105855d13959fff5d

commit e305677de59872674b0b7bb45e81844e1910e2ea
Author: Tony S Yu <tsyu80@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-25 23:15:42 -0500

    Fix PyQt4 segfault caused by PySide fix.
    
    I guess PySide saves the QApplication internally, while PyQt4 doesn't.
    Saving the QApplication as a global prevents it from getting garbage
    collected. Saving the QApplication as an instance variable in the
    ImageViewer also works, but that might prevent the ImageViewer from getting
    garbage collected in an interactive session. (weakref doesn't seem to work here.)

8	4	skimage/viewer/utils/core.py

commit c4299c46374995f1dbe31faa4b2c1b175a880829
Author: tonysyu <tsyu80@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-06-25 14:37:01 -0500

    Fix execution in IPython with qt backend.
    
    New QApplication and event-loop implementation stolen shamelessly from
    IPython. Strangely, running the viewer at the IPython prompt will
    open an orphan Matplotlib figure window, but running a script using
    `%run` does not.
    
    Only tested on PySide (not PyQt4).

23	8	skimage/viewer/utils/core.py

commit 20ae0a1ca283e5fcfc28260702ed511bc2130731
Author: Josh Warner (Mac) <warner.joshua@mayo.edu>
Date:   2013-06-01 22:12:05 -0500

    FEAT: Generalized n-dimensional array padding
    This PR exposes NumPy 1.8+ padding functionality to all
    users of scikit-image, regardless of their personal NumPy
    version.
    
    The improved (much better scaling with dimensionality)
    version introduced in NumPy 1.8 is used.

commit 44095eef81c7b98d119dc121a629331f6579fc1e
Author: Malcolm Reynolds <malcolm.reynolds@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-03-15 18:50:43 +0000

    FIX: number of peaks returned from feature.corner_peaks
    
    corner_peaks accepted a num_peaks argument, but the call
    to peak_local_max inside the function used np.inf instead
    of the value of this keyword argument, leading to an unbounded
    number of peaks being returned.

Date:   2012-11-19 23:38:58 -0600

    FEAT - combined API from is_local_maximum() into peak_local_max()
    
    is_local_maximum() is a wrapper function for peak_local_max()
    is_local_maximum() runs much faster (~20% of prior runtime, nearly = to peak_local_max())
    All tests in .feature and .morphology subpackages pass as written with these changes.

      * Fully document API
      * remove commented-out old algorithm in is_local_maximum()
      * add new tests for full coverage of new, more complex peak_local_max()

    BUG: Pass package directory as positional argument to nose.run
    
    When the package directory is passed to nosetest via the "where" argument (-w), that directory becomes the working directory. This causes problems because `skimage.io` will take precedence over the builtin `io` package.

commit 7a90420d9c23450a281258ba2fd4d57c23c8e178
Author: Tony S Yu <tsyu80@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-10-02 00:38:56 -0400

    DOC: Change algorithm for depth of API generation
    
    Previously, apigen documented all but the bottom-most level of modules in the package tree. This caused problems when different subpackages had different depths. Instead, just document subpackages (ignore python files, whose public functions should already be loaded into the subpackage).

commit c54d8d31f3a95a7734b30b2d5d9e58c1261b1a4b
Author: JDWarner <silvertrumpet999@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-24 11:30:45 -0500

    Docfix for img_as_float; appended myself to CONTRIBUTORS
    
    img_as_float() had a legacy note stating conversion would force
    negative values to the positive domain; this no longer described
    its functionality. Note changed to reflect the retention of negative
    values when converting from signed datatypes.
    
    When submitting my multichannel improvement to the random walker
    segmentation algorithm, I neglected to append my name to the
    CONTRIBUTORS file. Now fixed.

commit ee2092c6fa3c916bc3cbf36a4e40d428c300ff25
Author: JDWarner <silvertrumpet999@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-17 16:38:59 -0500

    Documentation fix for `labels` input in random_walker.
    
    This fix was needed because `labels` claimed it should be "of same
    shape as `data`", but this is no longer always the case. When
    multichannel=True, `labels` should be shaped like a SINGLE channel
    of `data`, i.e. without the final dimension denoting channels.

4	2	skimage/segmentation/random_walker_segmentation.py

commit e6ca084aee670d8c7f6f4c094e78e566d6d149d0
Author: Tony S Yu <tsyu80@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-02 13:22:58 -0400

    DOC: Remove inherited-members Sphinx role.
    
    Documenting inherited methods and attributes can lead to overly verbose docs. For example, the `Image` class, which subclasses ndarray, and various viewer-related classes, which subclass PyQt and Matplotlib classes, have hundreds of irrelevant methods added to the API docs.

0	1	doc/tools/apigen.py

    Either the role should be removed (as done here) or the inheritance-diagram extension needs to be added to the config file. Since skimage doesn't have a complicated class hierarchies, it's probably best to remove.

commit e8ddcefae351b7096890c608df559468e7ceb2f5
Author: JDWarner <silvertrumpet999@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-08-31 14:14:46 -0500

    PEP8 compliance, removed `scaling`, different data parsing.
    
    This commit represents all recommended changes since the last
    commit, notably:
    
    * PEP8 compliance (in new sections; a few old ones still
      noncompliant w/indentations)
    
    * Moved `depth` kwarg to end of list and in docstring.
      Clarified `depth` docstring, and added section in Notes
      further explaining this parameter.
    
    * Added section in Notes warning that for multichannel inputs,
      all channels are combined during scaling.  The user must
      separately normalize each channel prior to calling
      random_walker()
    
    * New method for parsing data, allowing more elegant gradient
      calculation code. Probably also more extensible. The 2D
      multispectral case forced this change.
    
    * New test: `test_multispectral_2d()`

43	54	skimage/segmentation/random_walker_segmentation.py
18	5	skimage/segmentation/tests/test_random_walker.py

Author: JDWarner <silvertrumpet999@gmail.com>
